lines:
7956

April 9, 1914.

ur. 8. 3. Kwan,

Tsing run College,

Peking, China. 
My dear Xwan:

Mr. Bancroft had handed me your note of the 7th inst., in which 
you ask that copies of our catalogue be sent to you. We are sending six of 
them under separate cover, and I hope that they will reach you safely and do 
some good missionary work. Naturally I am especially interested to know

that you are likely to influence one of your young men to come to Andover 
before entering college. We vd 11 give them a vary welcome when they arrive.

The Chinese delegation at Andover is not large this year, but it is a good 
one for all that. It is hearted by Tony leo, who is doing fine all-round

work; and the other members are Chow, Hsu, and Yong, the last a very recent

addition.

What about yourself! It seen ages since I bade you good-bye out 
there last year. That trip will always remain a delightful memory to me, 
and much a I enjoyed all of any wanderings about China, the trips around 
Peking, including those to Tsing Hua, are among the pleasantest memories 
of all. It rooms hard to realize that our dear friend ar. Tong Kaison 
has been taken from us. I certainly had most profound respect for him, 
and counted myself fortunate to enjoy his friendship. Can you te 11 ne

where his wife is at this time and what her address is!

I have wanted

to write her a note of sympathy but did not know where she could be found.

Be sure to come and see us as soon as you get back to this country.

Come and spend a day or two with me if it is possible.

Always sincerely yours,

Principal.

My dear Xwan:  Mr. Bancroft had handed me your note of the 7th inst., in which  you ask that copies of our catalogue be sent to you. We are sending six of  them under separate cover, and I hope that they will reach you safely and do  some good missionary work. Naturally I am especially interested to know  that you are likely to influence one of your young men to come to Andover  before entering college. We vd 11 give them a vary welcome when they arrive.  The Chinese delegation at Andover is not large this year, but it is a good  one for all that. It is hearted by Tony leo, who is doing fine all-round  work; and the other members are Chow, Hsu, and Yong, the last a very recent  addition.  What about yourself! It seen ages since I bade you good-bye out  there last year. That trip will always remain a delightful memory to me,  and much a I enjoyed all of any wanderings about China, the trips around  Peking, including those to Tsing Hua, are among the pleasantest memories  of all. It rooms hard to realize that our dear friend ar. Tong Kaison  has been taken from us. I certainly had most profound respect for him,  and counted myself fortunate to enjoy his friendship. Can you te 11 ne  where his wife is at this time and what her address is!  I have wanted  to write her a note of sympathy but did not know where she could be found.  Be sure to come and see us as soon as you get back to this country.  Come and spend a day or two with me if it is possible.  Always sincerely yours,  Principal.

metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Letter enclosing catalogues requested by Kwan and expressing interest in having more Chinese students at the school. The current delegation includes Tommy Lee, Chow, Hsu, and Wong.
metadata.collection: Head of School (Stearns) correspondence with Chinese alumni
